trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: Check out the [Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/) offer if you don't have a subscription yet.
trans-unit.target: Check out the [Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/) offer if you don't have a subscription yet.

trans-unit.source: On the command bar at the bottom of the window, click **New**.
trans-unit.target: On the command bar at the bottom of the window, click **New**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Compute**, click **Virtual Machine**, and then click **From Gallery**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Compute**, click **Virtual Machine**, and then click **From Gallery**.

trans-unit.source: Create a New Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: Create a New Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: Under the **SUSE** group, select an OpenSUSE virtual machine image, and then click arrow to continue.
trans-unit.target: Under the **SUSE** group, select an OpenSUSE virtual machine image, and then click arrow to continue.

trans-unit.source: On the first **Virtual machine configuration** page:
trans-unit.target: On the first **Virtual machine configuration** page:

trans-unit.source: Type a **Virtual Machine Name**, such as "testlinuxvm".
trans-unit.target: Type a **Virtual Machine Name**, such as "testlinuxvm".

trans-unit.source: Verify the **Tier** and pick a **Size**.
trans-unit.target: Verify the **Tier** and pick a **Size**.

trans-unit.source: The tier determines the sizes you can choose from.
trans-unit.target: The tier determines the sizes you can choose from.

trans-unit.source: The size affects the cost of using it, as well as configuration options such as how many data disks you can attach.
trans-unit.target: The size affects the cost of using it, as well as configuration options such as how many data disks you can attach.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Sizes for virtual machines](../articles/virtual-machines-size-specs.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Sizes for virtual machines](../articles/virtual-machines-size-specs.md).

trans-unit.source: Type a **New User Name**, or accept the default, **azureuser**.
trans-unit.target: Type a **New User Name**, or accept the default, **azureuser**.

trans-unit.source: This name is added to the Sudoers list file.
trans-unit.target: This name is added to the Sudoers list file.

trans-unit.source: Decide which type of **Authentication** to use.
trans-unit.target: Decide which type of **Authentication** to use.

trans-unit.source: For general password guidelines, see [Strong passwords](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms161962.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For general password guidelines, see [Strong passwords](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms161962.aspx).

trans-unit.source: On the next **Virtual machine configuration** page:
trans-unit.target: On the next **Virtual machine configuration** page:

trans-unit.source: Use the default **Create a new cloud service**.
trans-unit.target: Use the default **Create a new cloud service**.

trans-unit.source: In the **DNS Name** box, type a valid DNS name to use as part of the address, such as "testlinuxvm".
trans-unit.target: In the **DNS Name** box, type a valid DNS name to use as part of the address, such as "testlinuxvm".

trans-unit.source: In the **Region/Affinity Group/Virtual Network** box, select a region where this virtual image will be hosted.
trans-unit.target: In the **Region/Affinity Group/Virtual Network** box, select a region where this virtual image will be hosted.

trans-unit.source: Under **Endpoints**, keep the SSH endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Under **Endpoints**, keep the SSH endpoint.

trans-unit.source: You can add others now, or add, change, or delete them after the virtual machine is created.
trans-unit.target: You can add others now, or add, change, or delete them after the virtual machine is created.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want a virtual machine to use a virtual network, you **must** specify the virtual network when you create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want a virtual machine to use a virtual network, you **must** specify the virtual network when you create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can't add a virtual machine to a virtual network after you create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: You can't add a virtual machine to a virtual network after you create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Virtual Network Overview](virtual-networks-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Virtual Network Overview](virtual-networks-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: On the last **Virtual machine configuration** page, keep the default settings and then click the check mark to finish.
trans-unit.target: On the last **Virtual machine configuration** page, keep the default settings and then click the check mark to finish.

trans-unit.source: The portal lists the new virtual machine under **Virtual Machines**.
trans-unit.target: The portal lists the new virtual machine under **Virtual Machines**.

trans-unit.source: While the status is reported as **(Provisioning)**, the virtual machine is being set up.
trans-unit.target: While the status is reported as **(Provisioning)**, the virtual machine is being set up.

trans-unit.source: When the status is reported as **Running**, you can move on to the next step.
trans-unit.target: When the status is reported as **Running**, you can move on to the next step.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: Connect to the Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: You'll use SSH or PuTTY to connect to the virtual machine, depending on the operating system on the computer you'll connect from:
trans-unit.target: You'll use SSH or PuTTY to connect to the virtual machine, depending on the operating system on the computer you'll connect from:

trans-unit.source: From a computer running Linux, use SSH.
trans-unit.target: From a computer running Linux, use SSH.

trans-unit.source: At the command prompt, type:
trans-unit.target: At the command prompt, type:

trans-unit.source: Type the user's password.
trans-unit.target: Type the user's password.

trans-unit.source: From a computer running Windows, use PuTTY.
trans-unit.target: From a computer running Windows, use PuTTY.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have it installed, download it from the [PuTTY Download Page][PuTTYDownload].
trans-unit.target: If you don't have it installed, download it from the [PuTTY Download Page][PuTTYDownload].

trans-unit.source: Save **putty.exe** to a directory on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Save **putty.exe** to a directory on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt, navigate to that folder, and run **putty.exe**.
trans-unit.target: Open a command prompt, navigate to that folder, and run **putty.exe**.

trans-unit.source: Type the host name, such as "testlinuxvm.cloudapp.net", and type "22" for the **Port**.
trans-unit.target: Type the host name, such as "testlinuxvm.cloudapp.net", and type "22" for the **Port**.

trans-unit.source: PuTTY Screen
trans-unit.target: PuTTY Screen

trans-unit.source: Update the Virtual Machine (optional)
trans-unit.target: Update the Virtual Machine (optional)

trans-unit.source: After you're connected to the virtual machine, you can optionally install system updates and patches.
trans-unit.target: After you're connected to the virtual machine, you can optionally install system updates and patches.

trans-unit.source: To run the update, type:
trans-unit.target: To run the update, type:

trans-unit.source: Select **Software**, then **Online Update** to list available updates.
trans-unit.target: Select **Software**, then **Online Update** to list available updates.

trans-unit.source: Select **Accept** to start the installation and apply all new available patches (except the optional ones).
trans-unit.target: Select **Accept** to start the installation and apply all new available patches (except the optional ones).

trans-unit.source: After installation is done, select **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: After installation is done, select **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: Your system is now up to date.
trans-unit.target: Your system is now up to date.
